okapi: A peculiar mammal Okapia johnostoni closely related to the giraffe discovered in the deep forests of Belgian Kongo in 190

It is smaller than an ox and somewhat like a giraffe except that the neck is much shorter Like the giraffe it has no dewclaws There is a small prominence on each frontal bone of the male The color of the body is chiefly reddish chestnut the cheeks are yellowish white and the fore and hind legs above the knees and the haunches are striped with purplish black and cream color
oke: A Turkish and Egyptian weight equal to about 2
An Hungarian and Wallachian measure equal to about 2
okenite: A massive and fibrous mineral of a whitish color chiefly hydrous silicate of lime
okra: An annual plant Abelmoschus or Hibiscus esculentus whose green pods abounding in nutritious mucilage are much used for soups stews or pickles gumbo Written also ocra and ochra
